introduction: This video discusses the concept of Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) and its significance in various fields, including design innovation, computer science, digital products, and academic research. The speaker argues that HCI extends beyond computer science and redefines its boundaries, bringing assumptions and methods from disciplines like anthropology, sociology, and media studies. The video emphasizes the practical aspects of being a HCI researcher and the importance of cultivating competence in computer science and other related fields.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to HCI
content: Explanation of HCI as a phrase in the context of design innovation, computer science, and digital products.
Discussion on the importance of HCI in our daily lives and its relevance to various industries.
Mention of the existence of HCI jobs in companies, although they are not as common as other professions.
Introduction of the two largest organizations in the field of HCI: ACM and IEEE.

sections.title: Section 2: HCI Researcher Role and Responsibilities
content: Explanation of the role of a HCI researcher as a computer science professional coming together with social sciences and humanities.
Discussion on the second wave of HCI research involving collaboration with other disciplines.
Emphasis on the importance of cultivating competence in computer science and related fields.
Mention of the role of HCI researcher in design discipline.

sections.title: Section 3: HCI and Social Sciences
content: Explanation of how HCI extends beyond computer science and redefines its boundaries.
Discussion on the integration of assumptions and methods from disciplines like anthropology, sociology, and media studies.
Emphasis on the interdisciplinary nature of HCI research.
Mention of the role of HCI in addressing new kinds of questions and possibilities.
topics: Assumptions and Methods from Other Disciplines
New Kinds of Questions and Possibilities

sections.title: Section 4: HCI Education and Career Paths
content: Explanation of the importance of a university degree in terms of skill and competence in HCI-related fields.
Discussion on the time required to cultivate competence in computer science and other fields.
Mention of the existence of HCI schools at the graduate level.
Emphasis on the diverse career paths available in HCI.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion and Future of HCI
content: Summary of the key points discussed in the video.
Emphasis on the practical aspects of being a HCI researcher.
Discussion on the future of HCI and its continued evolution.
Call to action for further exploration of HCI in design discipline.
